articles.author: Adeboye Amosu
articles.title: NPFL: Ex- Super Eagles Defender Odunlami Rejoins Sunshine Stars
description: Former Super Eagles centre-back, Kunle Odunlami, has rejoined Nigeria Professional Football League outfit, Sunshine Stars for the rest of the season,
Odunlami joined the Owena Waves after severing ties with Sudanese club, Al Merreikh.
The 28-year-old  who was part of Nigeria squad to the 2014 African Nations Championship

articles.title: NPFL: Pillars Gun To Put Pressure On Lobi In Title Bid; Rangers, Akwa Clash In Enugu
description: Kano Pillars will look to close the gap on leaders Lobi Stars when they take on Katsina United in a Nigeria Professional Football League match-day 21
encounter at the Sani Abacha Stadium on Sunday League leaders Lobi Stars have the weekend off as their opponent, Enyimba who have a continental
engagement against CARA Brazzaville of Congo next Wednesday are putting finishing touches to their travel plans.

articles.title: Plateau United Hold Akwa United As Enyimba, FCIU Draw
description: Champions Plateau United rallied back to earn a share of the spoils against Akwa United in their rescheduled Nigeria Professional Football
League matchday 16 encounter at the Godswill Akpabio International Stadium, Uyo on Wednesday, Cyril Olisema put hosts Akwa United ahead in the 53rd minute
while Plateau United, who were without several of their key players in the game, netted the equaliser 16 minutes from time through Hamzat Owolabi.

articles.title: FIFA World Cup 2018: Nigeria hopeful of midfielder Wilfred Ndidi's return from injury before mega event
articles.description: Wilfred Ndidi, 21, is nursing a hamstring injury and is expected to be out of action for several weeks.

articles.title: Ogunbote Hits Out At Rangers Players Despite Away Draw Vs Wikki
description: Enugu Rangers head coach, Gbenga Ogunbote,has blamed his players for failing to make their dominance count in Sundayâ€™s NPFL match-day 20 clash against Wikki Tourists.
The Flying Antelopes extended their unbeaten run against the Bauchi club to seven games following the 1-1 draw at the New Jos Stadium.
The hosts took the lead on 14 minutes through Usman Manu but were pegged back by Tope Olusesiâ€™s strike 11 minutes before the break.

articles.author: Urowayino Warami â†’
articles.title: Lobi Extend Lead, MFM End Tornadoesâ€™ Run; Rangers, Pillars Claim Away Draws
description: Lobi Stars of Makurdi increased their lead at the top of the Nigeria Professional Football League to five points after a hard-fought 1-0 win against Sunshine Stars of Akure at the Aper Aku Stadium, Makurdi on Sunday,

Kehinde Adeyemi scored the decisive goal 17 minutes from time. At the Dan Anyiam Stadium, Owerri, Kano Pillars maintained second position in the table following a 1-1 draw against hosts Heartland who now look destined for a return to the Nigeria National League.

articles.author: ðŸ‘¤by Remi Sulola
articles.title: Rangers Coach Ogunbote Eager To Extend Unbeaten Run Vs Wikki To 7 Games
description: Enugu Rangers head coach, Gbenga Ogunbote, says his side is well motivated to beat Wikki Tourists in their Nigeria Professional Football League match-day 20 encounter today (Sunday) in Jos,
engagement against CARA Brazzaville of Congo next Wednesday are putting finishing touches to their travel plans.
The Flying Antelopes beat their hosts 3-0 in the reverse fixture last Sunday at the Nnamdi Azikwe Stadium with Godwin Aguda, Christian Madu and Kelvin Itoya getting the goals.

articles.author: Paul Gorst
articles.title: Olatunbosun Wins NPFL VAT Matchay 18 Wonder Goal Award
description: MFM FC forward Sikiru Olatunbosun has emerged the winner of the Nigeria Professional Football League VAT Wonder Goal award for matchday 18,
Olatunbosun beat the duo of Akwa Unitedâ€™s Ifeanyi Ifeanyi and Chidi Nwachukwu of Go Round FC to the honour.
The goal which came in MFMâ€™s 1-1 home draw against River United at the Agege Stadium, saw the talented forward unleash a
right-foot grounder from the edge of the 18-yard box that beat veteran goalkeeper Rotimi Sunday after receiving a pass from Chukwuka Onuwa.

articles.title: Tornadoes Coach Abara Seeks Extension To Unbeaten Run Vs MFM
description: Niger Tornadoes head coach, Hamza Abara, is keen to see his side maintain their unbeaten streak in the Nigeria Professional Football League when they take on MFM FC in a matchday 20 encounter on Sunday,
The Ikon-Allah Boys are without defeat in their last nine league games going into the fixture at the Agege Stadium.

articles.title: Lobi Seek To Extend Lead, MFM Threaten Tornadoesâ€™ Unbeaten Run; Lokosa Targets Goal No.17 For Pillars
description: The second stanza of the 2017/2018 Nigeria Professional Football League will start on Sunday with leaders Lobi Stars looking to hold on to
their position at the top of the log when they take on Sunshine Stars in Makurdi. Solomon Ogbeideâ€™s men who extended their unbeaten streak to five games following the
1-1 draw against same opponent last Sunday in Akure have seen their lead reduced from six to three points.

articles.author: Sid Lowe
articles.title: LMC Fine Yobe Desert Stars N4.25m For Crowd Troubles
description: The League Management Company (LMC) has slammed Yobe Desert Stars with a fine of N4.25m for breaching the framework and rules of the
Nigeria Professional Football League during their match day 19 encounter against Kwara United

According to a summary of the verdict posted on the LMC Twitter handle, Yobe Stars will play their next three home matches behind closed doors with the last two being suspended for a probationary period till end of this season .

articles.author: Christopher Simpson
articles.title: Pillars Pip Akwa United, Go Second; Plateau Canâ€™t Beat Wikki
description: Kano Pillars moved to the second position in the Nigeria Professional Football League after beating Akwa United 1-0 in their rescheduled matchday 15 fixture at the Sani Abacha Stadium on Wednesday,
Veteran midfielder Rabiu Ali scored the winning goal from the spot in the 38th minute.
The penalty was awarded after Akwa Unitedâ€™s right-back Etim Matthew tripped Nzube Anaezemba inside the box.

articles.title: Go Round Coach Elechi Gets â€˜Earn â€˜7 Points From 3 Games Ultimatumâ€™ Or Get Out
description: Go Round FC have handed a three-match ultimatum to their head coach, Ngozi Elechi, and his assistants to win at least seven points from their next three matches or get fired,
The management of the Omoku-based side issued the threat following the teamâ€™s recent poor run of form in the Nigeria Professional Football League.

articles.author: Emmanuel Okogba â†’
articles.title: Tornadoes Sign Ex-Home Eagles Defender Esieme On Loan From Rangers
description: Niger Tornadoes have signed former home-based Super Eagles defender, Bright Esieme, from Enugu Rangers on a loan deal for the rest of the current season,
The right-back has struggled for regular playing time at Rangers this season under Gbenga Ogunbote, and has decided to link up with the Minna club for the second stanza of the campaign.

articles.author: Don Silas
articles.title: Enyimba To Fine Dauda For Red Card Incident Vs Akwa United
description: Enyimba goalkeeper, Fatau Dauda, will be fined despite apologizing for his sending-off in Sundayâ€™s goalless draw against Akwa United in the Nigeria Professional Football League (NPFL), the club chairman Anyansi Agwu has stated.
The Ghana international, who has been impressive this season, was sent off for violent conduct off-the-ball in the 41st minute of the encounter.

articles.title: Rivers Unitedâ€™s Sochima Wins NPFL VAT Wonder Goal Award
description: Rivers Unitedâ€™s Sochima Elum has won the Nigeria Professional Football League VAT Wonder Goal Award for matchday 17,
Elum is the second Rivers United player to have picked the award this season following in the footsteps of his teammate Emeka Ogbugh who won the match day 15 honour

articles.description: Kanu was present at the Emirates Stadium on Sunday to honour Wenger.

articles.description: Super Eagles defender, Leon Balogun has reechoed the sentiments of top Nigerian football buffs for the team players to stay injury-free and fit for the 2018 FIFA World Cup tournament starting next month in Russia.

articles.author: Emmanuel Okogba â†’
articles.title: Biffo: Katsina United Will Play To Get Something At Plateau United
description: Katsina United head coach, Abdullahi Biffo, says they are not scared of coming up against Nigeria Professional Football League champions Plateau United in todayâ€™s matchday 19 encounter and is positive his side will get a favourable result from the game.
The Changi Boys sit in second position in the table six points behind leaders Lobi Stars.

A win or draw at the New Jos Stadium will see them maintain their position in the top half table and Biffo believes they can earn  a good result from the ground where they were thrashed 3-0 last season.

articles.author: Emmanuel Okogba â†’
articles.title: Pillars Deny Reports Of Plans To Sponsor Late Udojiâ€™s Childrenâ€™s Education
description: Kano Pillars have denied reports that they will keep sponsoring the education of the children of their late defender, Chinedu Udoji.

Udoji passed away aged 28 on February 18 in a ghastly motor accident hours after Kano Pillarsâ€™ Nigeria Professional Football League clash against his former club Enyimba at the Sani Abacha Stadium. He left behind a wife and two very young children.

articles.author: Emmanuel Okogba â†’
articles.title: Lobi Stars Seek To Extend Lead; Enyimba, Akwa United Clash In Calabar
description: League leaders Lobi Stars will seek to extend their lead at the top of the Nigeria Professional Football League when they face Sunshine Stars in a match-day 19 encounter at the Akure Sports Complex on Sunday,
The Makurdi club sit at the top of the log with 33 points, six more than second placed Katsina United who are up against champions Plateau United in Jos.

articles.author: Emmanuel Okogba â†’
articles.title: LMC Fine MFM, Plateau United Over Misconduct
description: The League Management Company have fined MFM FC the sum N3m for breaching the league framework and rules in their Nigeria Professional Football League match day 18 encounter against River United,

The encounter at the Agege Stadium, Lagos ended in a 1-1 draw. The LMC announced in a series of tweets on Friday that they fined the club N1m for their fansâ€™ encroachment onto the field of play immediately after the match at the Agege Stadium, Lagos.

articles.author: Emmanuel Okogba â†’
articles.title: Plateau United Beat Kwara United, MFM Hold Rangers
description: Nigeria Professional Football League champions Plateau United moved into the top half of the table following a 2-0 win against Kwara United in a rescheduled match day 13 encounter  at the New Jos Stadium on Thursday.
Tosin Omoyele pounced on a through ball in the 20th minute and fired the ball past Kwara Unitedâ€™s goalkeeper Jonah Usman to open scoring
